name: Supermedium
headline: VR space of immersive utilities
description:
Supermedium is a VR space to read books and comics, watch videos, view art, browse the Web, send messages, browse social media in a comfortable and focused environment. We're building a post-screen world to improve how we interact with technology by providing more screens, larger screens even while laying down, in a portable form factor.

https://supermedium.com/

generated_description:
**Supermedium: Redefining the VR Experience**

Founded in 2017 during Y Combinator's W18 batch, Supermedium operates from the vibrant tech hub of San Francisco. With a lean team of just two members, they focus on a forward-thinking mission: creating a VR space that enhances how we interact with digital content. Imagine reading books and comics, watching videos, browsing the web, and even engaging with art—all in an immersive, comfortable environment. 

They’re not just about replicating screens; they’re building a post-screen world. The idea here is to offer more screens and larger displays that you can enjoy while lying down, all packed into a portable format. This is about escaping the confines of traditional screen interactions and diving into a more immersive, engaging experience—reimagining how we connect with technology.

Supermedium also champions 3D content creation, utilizing generative AI workflows inspired by the creators of A-Frame, allowing users to create dynamic, interactive virtual environments. 

To get a glimpse into their world, check out their website [Supermedium.com](https://supermedium.com) or connect with them through [Twitter](https://supermedium.com/<https:/x.com/aframevr>) and [Discord](https://supermedium.com/<https:/discord.gg/uhBVX6GDSf>).

In summary, Supermedium is carving out a niche in the virtual reality landscape, focusing on usability and immersion while keeping technology intuitive and accessible.
